Let the polynomial $$P(x) := x^n+a_1x^{n-1}+\ldots+a_n$$ with complex
coefficients $a_j$ be , i.e. irreducible in the field
$\mathbb{Q}(a_1,\,\ldots,\,a_n)$ of its coefficients. If the equation
$P(x) = 0$ can be and if all of its roots are real, then no root may be
expressed with the numbers $a_j$ using mere real unless the $n$ of the
equation is an of 2.
